intro: Allosorus myrtillifolius, commonly known as the myrtle-leaved allosorus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves that resemble those of the myrtle plant, hence its common name. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, often found in rocky or calcareous soils. Allosorus myrtillifolius is valued for its ornamental appeal and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
